result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Ryan Nance

records.addlTxt:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No contact with victim or victim's residence.
No use or possession of dangerous weapons.

1:27 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Matthew Ryan Nance appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint and waives reading. Def. understands the charges and potential penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and No contact with victim or victim's residence. State notes Def. other open pending cases. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court considers factors and orders a $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and No contact with victim or victim's residence. Court questions Def. on status of counsel, Def. responds. Def. was appointed a court appointed Atty. and feels it will no longer be an option. State requests to set for an Adjourned Initial Appearance with other newest case court date, 22CM74, and requests this case track along. State is in compliance with victims rights and requests No use or possession of dangerous weapons be added to conditions of bond. Court orders No use or possession of dangerous weapons be added to bond conditions.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
